/* Name: define-table-constraint-switch-procedure.sql Purpose: turn off (NOCHECK) or on (CHECK) constraints so that incremental changes to tables can be made more easily. Created: 7-JAN-2005 George J. Carrette */ create procedure table_constraint_switch(@keyword varchar(32)) AS BEGIN DECLARE @LINES TABLE(LINE NVARCHAR(256)) DECLARE @WORKPTR CURSOR SET @WORKPTR = CURSOR FOR SELECT NAME FROM SYSOBJECTS WHERE TYPE = 'U ' OPEN @WORKPTR DECLARE @TBL_NAME VARCHAR(64) FETCH NEXT FROM @WORKPTR INTO @TBL_NAME WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 BEGIN DECLARE @SQL NVARCHAR(256) DECLARE @DCL NVARCHAR(256) SET @SQL = 'ALTER TABLE [' + @TBL_NAME + '] ' + @KEYWORD + ' CONSTRAINT ALL' SET @DCL = '' execute sp_executesql @SQL,@DCL INSERT INTO @LINES VALUES(@SQL) FETCH NEXT FROM @WORKPTR INTO @TBL_NAME END CLOSE @WORKPTR SELECT * FROM @LINES
END
